job_title: Office of Admissions Work Study Employee in Arkadelphia, AR
pros: The very best reason to work at Ouachita Baptist University is the people that form the community here. It is support and authenticity like no other place I've been!
cons: The only downside to working at Ouachita Baptist University as a student worker is that we can't work more than a few hours per week.

pros: Quaint, pretty campus. Several new/updated facilities. Close connection to the community.
cons: Tiny town with limited options and many outdated buildings. Baptist ideals make for a strict campus feel, especially for the Arts.

pros: Great community and very controlled environment
cons: Very small community and hard to keep personal life to oneself

pros: Loved the people and sense of community.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Arkadelphia, AR
cons: The pay was alright but could have been better given the task I was assigned.

review_title: A work environment that is familial and committed to excellence and truly serving students and their families.
pros:
An institution you can feel good about promoting.
Positive work environment that encourages growth.
Transparency in leadership.
Energetic campus life.
Highly engaged community surrounding.
Close-knit on-campus community among faculty/staff/students.
Regional travel.
Fun, engaging events.
Rising PTO plan.
cons:
Pay is fair, but not exactly competitive. In my experience, this reflects Ouachita's commitment to providing high quality education to students at an affordable rate - the faculty and staff are there because they're invested in students and believe in Ouachita. If you're primarily money-motivated or expecting to get rich, this is not the institution for you.
Lots of travel during college-fair season and evening/weekend events throughout the entire year. They're fun and purposeful, just know you'll have many busy weekends.
Not a lot of professional development opportunities so far.

review_title: Southern Baptist school in a small town
pros: straight forward with beliefs, small town (if you like that)
cons: very little diversity, pay is below average, main theatre facility is very out of date

pros: Takes care of student workers. Able to balance work, studies, and social life.
cons: Compensation could be more for the amount of work (depending on job).
